I’d had it on this trip. By day, I was beset by self-critical thoughts, which felt like incessant lacerations. In the dark, I was haunted by altitude-amplified nightmares, about being chased by Nazis or fighting with unpleasable exes. Besides, it was easy for Parkinson to be upbeat: She was the first British woman to climb Manaslu, the towering 8,163-metre-high peak we were circling on this trek in the Nepalese Himalayas.

“That’s it,” Parkinson finally said as we reached the height of the day’s climb. ARTICLE CONTINUES BELOW googletag.cmd.push(function() { googletag.display('article-instory-leaderboard-1'); }); ARTICLE CONTINUES BELOW googletag.cmd.push(function() { googletag.display('article-instory-1'); });

I plunked down on a rock and withheld a scream that surely would have echoed through the Himalayas. Having all this time to think on this long-distance trek, without being able to distract myself, was far tougher than I’d expected — but as I would learn, that was the whole point.

I had come to Nepal on the brink of burnout after a dizzying year of work and travel. I wanted a break but not on a beach, so I decided to check off a box on my bucket list by booking a trek in the Himalayas.

Buddhist prayer flags over a remote village in the Nepalese Himalayas. Joel Balsam

I’d heard about overtourism on Everest, and the new road that had brought honking cars to the Annapurna Circuit, so I wanted a more under-the-radar experience. The Manaslu Lodge Circuit, led by tour operator Exodus Travels, felt perfect: two weeks of walking, with full portage, to a max elevation of 5,130 metres. “You’ll have lots of time to think,” said a friend, whose own tea house trek had inspired me.

After checking into Kathmandu’s Hotel Royal Singi, I wandered into Thamel, the Nepalese capital’s gear bazaar. As motorcycles whizzed around me like birds over Wile E. Coyote’s head, a local with a Hollywood-honed accent invited me into his family’s tiny gallery. Lining the walls were some of the most vibrant and intricate artworks I’d ever laid eyes on, and one hypnotized me.

“That’s a mandala,” said the saleswoman, explaining that it’s a Buddhist meditation tool where you focus on the painting and allow your eyes to follow different pathways, past various obstacles, to the palace at the centre, which is meant to indicate the path to enlightenment. The final, most challenging obstacle, she pointed out, is our thoughts. .viafoura-engagement-starter { margin-bottom: 16px; clear:both;} .vf-conversation-starter__ad { flex-basis:300px; } .viafoura-engagement-starter * { font-family: Merriweather Sans,sans-serif; } .vf-conversation-starter_text-title { font-size: 24px; color: #333; } .vf-conversation-starter_text > span:nth-child(2), .vf-conversation-starter__header-title{ display: none; } .viafoura-engagement-starter .vf-conversation-starter_link { background-color: #006ED2 !important; display: flex !important; justify-content: center; padding-top: 13px !important; } .viafoura-engagement-starter .vf-conversation-starter__header-title, .viafoura-engagement-starter .vf-editors-pick_container-readmore{ color: #006ED2 !important; } .viafoura-engagement-starter .vf-conversation-starter__header-line { margin-left: 8px; } .vf-post-name-button__username, .vf-content-text > p:nth-child(1) > span:nth-child(1) { font-family: Merriweather Sans,sans-serif; } .viafoura-engagement-starter .vf-post-name-button__username { color: #686868 !important; } .viafoura-engagement-starter .vf-conversation-starter__content:has(.vf-conversation-starter__content-box:empty) { display: none !important; } .vf-conversation-starter__ad:has(+ div.vf-conversation-starter__content:not(visible)) { margin:auto !important; } .div.vf-content-text:nth-child(1) > p:nth-child(1) > span:nth-child(1) { color: #333 !important; } @media only screen and (max-width: 810px){ .vf-conversation-starter_link { font-size: 13px !important; } } .vf-conversation-starter_link svg { display: none; } @media (min-width: 1025px) { div.vf-content-text:nth-child(1) > p:nth-child(1) > span:nth-child(1) { font-size: 16px; line-height: 24px; } }

After meeting my trekking group of six plummy Brits and one Canadian, all over 55, we set off in a rickety bus along a ludicrously busy road before parking and setting off on our hike. I was giddy with excitement as we crossed rice paddy hills, gushing waterfalls, quaint stone houses and a canyon with a raging river below.

Rice paddy fields and villages seen on the writer’s first day of trekking in Nepal. Joel Balsam

The itinerary called for walking 10 miles a day, at the “slow and steady” pace set by our experienced Tamang guide Saroj Pukhrin. Going slow is important for handling the elevation, he explained. Soon, though, our tedious progress began to dampen my excitement. A sense of frustration set in. And most frustrating was the racing going on in my head.

I was making mental to-do lists for after the hike, ridiculously long lists that split into even more lists. I thought, with hopelessness, about the war in the Middle East, and the trials of my chosen career in journalism. But mostly, I focused on an existential question that had been plaguing me for the past year: Where do I belong? I had no easy answer, especially as I struggled to click with my travel companions.

I considered listening to podcasts for the distraction, but I couldn’t bear the judging voices in my head that said I should be appreciating the stunning snow-capped peaks and jagged cliffs around me instead. I’d used the Headspace app enough to know I was trapped in my “monkey mind,” but nothing sounded more awful than sitting down to meditate.

After the fateful acclimatization hike, I felt I’d hit rock bottom, even though I’d never been at a higher elevation with my feet still on the ground. And then I remembered the mandala. ARTICLE CONTINUES BELOW googletag.cmd.push(function() { googletag.display('article-instory-leaderboard-2'); }); ARTICLE CONTINUES BELOW googletag.cmd.push(function() { googletag.display('article-instory-2'); });

As we walked through Tibetan-style villages with red and gold prayer wheels, carved stones and temples filled with vivid, intense paintings, I recalled that these trails were pilgrimages long before they were a bucket-list destination for anxious Canadians like me.

Rather than simply being for pleasure, pilgrimages are critical practices in the journey to enlightenment because they force you to deal with, accept and not be attached to your thoughts. And that’s way harder than any workout.

Writer Joel Balsam during his Manaslu circuit trek in Nepal. Courtesy of Joel Balsam

After taking some pills for an altitude headache and seeing majestic Manaslu ablaze in a tangerine sunrise, I felt my mind beginning to calm. I started to grow fonder of my tour mates and was fascinated to learn about our Tamang porters, who belong to an ethnic group that’s long been undervalued, especially in comparison with Sherpas. Later, on the way down the mountain, I carried my pack on my forehead like a porter for 10 kilometres, which gave me even more appreciation for their nearly neck-breaking work.

The night before we took on the highest point on the hike, the Larkya Pass at 5,130 metres, we were squished into the roughest tea house yet, with three beds lined up in a single room. But I didn’t mind.

Up at 3:30 a.m., we trudged through the snow, past way more tour groups than we’d seen until this point, and stopped to give a struggling hiker some oxygen. When it was my turn to take a photo among the fluttering prayer flags atop the pass, I felt triumphant, and not just because of all the steps I’d taken.

उत्साह केँ मंद करय लागल।एकटा हताशाक भाव सेट भ' गेल.आ सबसँ बेसी कुंठाक भाव छल हमर माथ मे रेसिंग चलि रहल छल.हम पैदल यात्राक बाद मानसिक टू-डू लिस्ट बना रहल छलहुं, हास्यास्पद रूप सं लंबा सूची जे आओर बेसी लिस्ट में विभाजित छल.हम सोचलहुँ, निराशाक संग, मध्य पूर्वक युद्धक विषय मे, आ पत्रकारिता मे अपन चुनल कैरियरक परीक्षण.मुदा बेसी काल, हम एकटा एहन अस्तित्ववादी प्रश्न पर ध्यान केंद्रित केलहुं जे हमरा पिछला साल सं परेशान करैत छल: हम कतय छी?हमरा लग कोनो आसान जवाब नहि छल, खास क' जखन हम अपन यात्रा संगी सभक संग क्लिक करबा लेल संघर्ष करैत रही.हम विकर्षणक लेल पॉडकास्ट सुनबा पर विचार केलहुं, मुदा माथक निर्णायक आवाज जे कहलक जे हमरा चारू कातक आश्चर्यजनक बर्फ सं ग्रसित चोटी आ दांतेदार चट्टान सबहक सराहना करबाक चाही.हम हेडस्पेस ऐप के एतेक उपयोग केने रही जे ई बुझि सकैत छलहुं जे हम अपन “मॉन्की माइंड” में फंसल छी, मुदा ध्यान करय लेल बैसय सं बेसी भयावह किछु नहिं लागल.भाग्यशाली एक्लीमेटाइजेशन हाइक के बाद हमरा लागल जे हम रॉक बॉटम पर टक्कर मारि देने छी, भले हम कहियो पैर जमीन पर पैर राखि कहियो ऊँचाई पर नहिं छलहुं.आ बाल्टी-लिस्टक गंतव्य छल.खाली सुख के लेलऽ होय के बजाय, तीर्थयात्रा आत्मज्ञान के यात्रा में आलोचनात्मक प्रथा छै, कैन्हेंकि वू आपक॑ अपनऽ विचारऽ स॑ निपटै लेली, स्वीकार करै लेली आरू ओकरा स॑ जुड़लऽ नै होय लेली मजबूर करै छै ।आ से कोनो वर्कआउट स बेसी कठिन अछि।लेखक जोएल बालसम नेपाल में अपन मनस्लु सर्किट ट्रेक के दौरान |ऊंचाई के माथ दर्द के लेल किछु गोली खयला के बाद आ राजसी मनस्लू के एकटा टैंजरीन के सूर्योदय में दाहेज देखला के बाद जोएल बालसम के सौजन्य सं हमरा लागल जे हमर दिमाग शांत होबय लागल.हम अपन टूर के साथी के फोंडर बढ़य लगलहुं आ अपन तमांग पोर्टर के बारे में जानय लेल मोहित भ गेलहुं, जे एकटा जातीय समूह के अछि जेकर बहुत दिन सं कम मूल्यांकन कयल गेल अछि, खास क शेरापा के तुलना में.बाद में पहाड़ सं नीचा उतरैत काल हम अपन पैक 10 किलोमीटर के लेल पोर्टर जकाँ अपन कपार पर ल गेल छलहुं, जाहि सं हमरा लोकनिक लगभग गर्दन तोड़यवला काजक लेल हमरा आओर बेसी सराहना भेटल.पैदल यात्राक सब सं ऊँच स्थान पर हमरा लोकनि 5,130 मीटर पर लारक्या दर्रा पर उतरबा सं पहिने राति में हमरा लोकनि कें एखन धरि सब सं बेसी खुरदुरा चाहक घर में चीरल गेल छल, जाहि में तीन टा बेड एकल कोठली में लाइन में लागल छल.मुदा हमरा कोनो दिक्कत नहि भेल।3:30 बजे ऊपर, हम सब बर्फक बीच सं टकरा गेलहुं, एहि ठाम धरि देखलहुं, आ एकटा संघर्षरत पैदल यात्री कें किछु ऑक्सीजन देबय लेल रुकि गेलहुं.जखन पासक ऊपरक फड़फड़ाइत प्रार्थना झंडाक बीच फोटो खिचब हमर बारी छल, तखन हमरा विजयी लागल, आ मात्र हमरा द्वारा कयल गेल सब डेगक कारणे नहिं.

title: DB team leaves Bangladesh for Nepal to investigate MP Anwarul murder - newagebd.net
description: DB team leaves Bangladesh for Nepal to investigate MP Anwarul murder  newagebd.net
publisher.title: newagebd.net
full_article:
A four-member team from the Detective Branch of Dhaka Metropolitan Police is en route to Nepal following an investigation in India, to probe the murder of ruling Awami League lawmaker from Jhenaidah-4 constituency, MP Anwarul Azim.

The team, led by the DMP DB chief, Mohammad Harun-or-Rashid, is focusing on the main accused in the murder, Akhtaruzzaman Shaheen.

(function(uniqueid,sizex,sizey,element,document,jslink,adplaceid,siteid) { var l = document.createElement(element); l.setAttribute("src",jslink); l.setAttribute("async",'true'); l.setAttribute("type","text/javascript"); var x=document.getElementById(uniqueid); x.id = Math.random().toString(36).substr(2, 9); x.appendChild(l, x); l.onload = function () { ServeAdvertisement(siteid,adplaceid,x,sizex,sizey); } })("ADL660300250",300,250,"script",document,"https://bangladesh-static.adfinix.com/adfinix.js",419,660)

Before departing Dhaka, Harun addressed media reports about the arrest of a person named Siam in Nepal. ‘I can’t say anything at this moment. But we are going for an investigation. We will let you know soon,’ Harun told journalists at Dhaka Airport this morning.

Harun revealed that the suspects in Anwarul murder had used the Nepal route.

‘We have spoken to Jihad in India. We have several suspects related to Anwarul’s murder, apart from the main culprit. Both sides have discussed this matter,’ he said.

He also noted that several major criminals from Bangladesh, including suspects in Anawarul murder, have recently been using the Kolkata route.

‘Considering everything, we have also written to Interpol to check if there are any criminals in that area. Overall, we are going to Nepal mainly for investigation,’ Harun added.

title: DB chief leading team in Nepal to probe Azim murder - The Business Post
description: DB chief leading team in Nepal to probe Azim murder  The Business Post
publisher.title: The Business Post
full_article:
A four-member team from the Detective Branch (DB) of the Dhaka Metropolitan Police (DMP) is en route to Nepal following an investigation in India, to probe the murder of Jhenaidah-4 MP Anwarul Azim Anar.

The team, led by the DB Chief Mohammad Harun-or-Rashid, is focusing on the main accused in the murder, Akhtaruzzaman Shaheen.

Before departing Dhaka, Harun addressed media reports about the arrest of a person named Siam in Nepal.

googletag.cmd.push(function() { googletag.display("div-gpt-ad-1676120529839-0"); });

“I can't say anything at this moment. But we are going for an investigation. We will let you know soon,” Harun told journalists at Dhaka airport on Saturday morning, reports UNB.

Harun revealed that the suspects in Anar's murder had used the Nepal route. "We have spoken to Jihad in India. We have several suspects related to Anar's murder, apart from the main culprit. Both sides have discussed this matter," he said.

He also noted that several major criminals from Bangladesh, including suspects in Anar's murder, have recently been using the Kolkata route.

“Considering everything, we have also written to Interpol to check if there are any criminals in that area. Overall, we are going to Nepal mainly for investigation," Harun added.

title: ‘We feel erased’: Nepal’s asexual community vie for visibility in queer spaces - South China Morning Post
description: ‘We feel erased’: Nepal’s asexual community vie for visibility in queer spaces  South China Morning Post
publisher.title: South China Morning Post
full_article:
Asexuality is the absence of sexual attraction with little interest in sexual activities, while aromanticism is a lack of romantic attraction or longing to form romantic relationships. However, both sexual orientations have a desire for platonic and emotionally intimate relationships.

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"ImageObject","caption":"Manita Newa Khadgi at the headquarters for Nepali Aspecs community. Photo: Bibek Bhandari","url":"https://cdn.i-scmp.com/sites/default/files/d8/images/canvas/2024/05/31/642f5f5b-121b-438d-82c4-5613e8fd961c_80bf8028.jpg"} Manita Newa Khadgi at the headquarters for Nepali Aspecs community. Photo: Bibek Bhandari

Nepal has been touted as a beacon for queer rights in Asia and is among the few countries granting sexual minorities equal protection in the constitution. Last year, the country’s top court issued an interim order allowing queer individuals to register their nuptials in government offices until a marriage equality law is passed.

But some rights advocates claim Nepal’s queer movement is not entirely inclusive, with the asexual community demanding to claim its space.

When not working as a doctor, Khadgi often gathers their team at the ground floor of their house in Kathmandu, which is also the headquarters for Nepali Aspecs. It is covered with pride flags, has literature on asexuality, and a blackboard scribbled with the group’s agenda – to be a welcoming place for people to share experiences and plan their advocacy works.

Khadgi is passionate when speaking and does not mince words, accusing many queer rights advocates of tokenising the asexual community only when discussing intersectionality and inclusivity. They says aphobia is prevalent mostly in the queer community because asexual and aromantic people “decentre romance and sex” that is seen as a key part of queer culture.

“Queerness is seen as something so rooted psychologically in people in terms of sexual and romantic attraction that asexuality and aromanticism fundamentally sound opposite of what queerness stands for,” Khadgi says.

“Queers know what it means to be ostracised and not being understood, how does that translate to you not trying to include others?”

“It’s not that we don’t feel acknowledged, we feel erased,” they say.

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"VideoObject","contentUrl":"https://www.youtube.com/embed/F9LHPU8tVcU?wmode=transparent&jqoemcache=UdCOW&enablejsapi=1&playsinline=1","description":"Thailand’s lower house of parliament approves bill recognising same-sex marriage","duration":"PT2M33S","embedUrl":"https://www.scmp.com/week-asia/lifestyle-culture/article/3264865/we-feel-erased-nepals-asexual-community-vie-visibility-queer-spaces","name":"Thailand’s lower house of parliament approves bill recognising same-sex marriage","thumbnailUrl":["https://cdn.i-scmp.com/sites/default/files/d8/video/thumbnail/2024/03/28/CLEAN---thumbnail.jpg","https://cdn.i-scmp.com/sites/default/files/styles/wide_landscape/public/d8/video/thumbnail/2024/03/28/CLEAN---thumbnail.jpg?itok=cF0qf855","https://cdn.i-scmp.com/sites/default/files/styles/768x768/public/d8/video/thumbnail/2024/03/28/CLEAN---thumbnail.jpg?itok=Hff1qo8v"],"uploadDate":"2024-06-01T11:00:13.000Z"} {"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"ImageObject","url":"https://cdn.i-scmp.com/sites/default/files/styles/wide_landscape/public/d8/video/thumbnail/2024/03/28/CLEAN---thumbnail.jpg?itok=cF0qf855"} 02:33 Thailand’s lower house of parliament approves bill recognising same-sex marriage Thailand’s lower house of parliament approves bill recognising same-sex marriage

The messages Khadgi initially received on Instagram showed a lack of understanding about asexuality in absence of wider visibility. They said people not knowing about the label made them “pathologise themselves, feeling alienated and dehumanised.”

“I spent so much of my life not knowing and not understanding,” Khadgi says, tearing up. “I can’t fathom that every moment that I am not doing anything, thousands of other people are suffering not knowing about themselves.”

The community has helped several people questioning their sexual orientation or seeking acceptance. While one group member said becoming a part of Nepali Aspecs has been “validating and healing”, another said it has helped “to self-explore and discover how I viewed the world was not wrong”.

A 23-year-old, who wished to be called Brownie and identifies on the asexuality spectrum, said they instantly felt accepted in the Aspecs group as it was “more community-focused than activism oriented”.

“When you go to other queer groups, it feels you’re going to a certain camp and need to fit in – you feel like an outsider,” Brownie says. “I never felt that here.”

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"ImageObject","caption":"Nepali Aspecs members meet for their first offline event in Kathmandu, holding an asexual flag to mark International Asexuality Day in 2022. Photo: Handout","url":"https://cdn.i-scmp.com/sites/default/files/d8/images/canvas/2024/05/31/d2d79da9-435e-4e5b-8ece-2964cc3e73c8_987b2a26.jpg"} Nepali Aspecs members meet for their first offline event in Kathmandu, holding an asexual flag to mark International Asexuality Day in 2022. Photo: Handout

Madhurima Bhadra, a gender and public health educator, agreed there is a siloing of different identities in the queer spectrum in Nepal, which she says is detrimental to the overall movement. Many queer organisations are competing for funds from international donor agencies and visibility, which likely leads to a gap in whose voice is heard more prominently, she says.

“To address these inequalities and lack of cohesion would require a change in thought and ideology that everyone in the LGBTQIA community is equally important, and if one group is more marginalised than it holds the whole community back,” Bhadra said.

“The LGBTQIA movement should not be about which organisation is doing what for whom, but rather about what they are collectively doing for the entire community.”

Khadgi and their team are trying to change such thoughts, both online and offline.

On Instagram, Nepali Aspecs aims to provide accurate information on asexuality and aromanticism, along with different identities within the spectra, which is largely missing in Nepal and elsewhere.

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"ImageObject","caption":"Members of the LGBTQ community at a rally in Kathmandu. Photo: Shutterstock","url":"https://cdn.i-scmp.com/sites/default/files/d8/images/canvas/2024/05/31/bafb0e53-8132-4caf-90c4-eafea3e2005d_df26de69.jpg"} Members of the LGBTQ community at a rally in Kathmandu. Photo: Shutterstock

Khadgi says it is important to realise that love can exist without attraction, and many asexual and aromantic people are seeking platonic partnerships without forcing romance and sex into them.

“It is a legitimate and fulfilling way of existing for us,” they say.

The Nepali Aspecs community aims to amplify that message. Ahead of Pride month in June, the community is hosting pre-Pride hang-outs, a series of events and interaction programmes to assert their place in the queer movement and become visible to more people on the asexual and aromantic spectrum who might be in search of a community.

“To find out about oneself is the first step, and so many people don’t know that,” Khadgi says. “I created this group out of compulsion because I was desperate to find another Nepali asexual person. But every time a new person comes to us now, it feels magical.”

“Just four years ago, I thought asexual people did not even exist in Nepal and if I were the only one,” Khadgi said. “Now we have a community.”

केरऽ शीर्ष न्यायालय न॑ एगो अंतरिम आदेश जारी करलकै जेकरा स॑ विचित्र व्यक्ति सिनी क॑ अपनऽ विवाह समानता कानून पारित होय तलक सरकारी कार्यालयऽ म॑ अपनऽ विवाह दर्ज करै के अनुमति देलऽ गेलऽ छेलै ।लेकिन कुछ अधिकार के पक्षधर दावा करै छै कि नेपाल के विचित्र आंदोलन पूर्ण रूप स॑ समावेशी नै छै, जेकरा म॑ अलैंगिक समुदाय अपनऽ अंतरिक्ष के दावा करै के मांग करै छै ।जखन डाक्टर के रूप में काज नै करै छै त खाद्गी अक्सर काठमांडू में अपनऽ घर के भूतल पर अपनऽ टीम इकट्ठा करै छै, जे नेपाली एस्पेक के मुख्यालय भी छै ।एकरा प्राइड झंडा स॑ ढकलऽ छै, अलैंगिकता के बारे म॑ साहित्य छै, आरू समूह केरऽ एजेंडा के साथ एक ब्लैकबोर्ड स्क्रिबल छै – जेकरा स॑ लोगऽ लेली अनुभव साझा करै आरू अपनऽ वकालत के काम के योजना बनाबै लेली एगो स्वागत योग्य जगह बनी जाय छै ।खद्गी बोलै के समय भावुक छै आरू शब्दऽ के कीमा नै करै छै, जेकरा म॑ बहुत विचित्र अधिकार के पक्षधरऽ प॑ अलैंगिक समुदाय के टोकन करै के आरोप लगै छै जब॑ इंटरसेक्शनलिटी आरू समावेशी के चर्चा करलऽ जाय छै ।हुनकऽ कहना छै कि अफोबिया अधिकतर विचित्र समुदाय म॑ प्रचलित छै, कैन्हेंकि अलैंगिक आरू सुगंधित लोगऽ क॑ “विकेन्द्र रोमांस आरू सेक्स” छै जेकरा क्वीयर संस्कृति केरऽ एगो प्रमुख अंग के रूप म॑ देखलऽ जाय छै ।खद्गी कहै छै, “विक्रय क॑ यौन आरू रोमांटिक आकर्षण के दृष्टि स॑ लोगऽ म॑ मनोवैज्ञानिक रूप स॑ एतना जड़ के रूप म॑ देखलऽ जाय छै जेकरा लेली विचित्रता के खड़ा होय के बात के विपरीत अलैंगिकता आरू सुगंधितता के विपरीत ध्वनितता छै ।“क्वीयर के पता छै कि बहिष्कार नै करलऽ जाय आरू समझै के की मतलब छै, वू कार्यक्रम के आयोजन करी रहलऽ छै । एक समुदाय के।खद्गी कहैत छथि, “अपना के बारे में पता लगाबय लेल पहिल डेग अछि, आ एतेक लोक के ई बात नहिं बुझल छनि.”ओ कहला जे हम एहि समूह कए मजबूरी स बाहर निकाललहुं, किया कि हम एकटा आओर नेपाली अलैंगिक व्यक्ति कए खोजबा लेल बेताब छलहुं।मुदा हर बेर कोनो नव व्यक्ति आब हमरा सब लग अबैत अछि, त' ओ जादुई बुझाइत अछि।”खदगी कहलनि जे, एखनहि चारि साल पहिने हमरा लागल जे नेपाल मे अलैंगिक लोक सेहो नहि अछि आ जौं हमहीं टा रहितहुं।“आब हमरा सभक एकटा समुदाय अछि।”
label: Interview

title: A new option for Nepali food debuts in Boston's northwest suburbs - NECN
description: A new option for Nepali food debuts in Boston's northwest suburbs  NECN
publisher.title: NECN
full_article:
The dining scene in Arlington has changed quite a bit over the years. Once known mainly for its Greek pizza houses and takeout Chinese food, it’s now a town with quite a variety of options for different cuisines.

Indeed, while this Boston suburb may not have much in the way of high-end dining or destination spots, it is certainly a community full of outstanding eateries that won’t break the bank, including highly regarded Mexican, Indian, Vietnamese, Greek, Korean, Italian, Turkish, Thai, Lebanese and Japanese eateries.

Now, Arlington is home to a restaurant that features Nepali fare: Zomsa Restaurant and Bar. It’s another local option for inexpensive street food that’s already starting to make a name for itself with outstanding dishes.

Zomsa first opened in April, moving into the space in the center of town that had been home to Taipei Tokyo and, before that, Shanghai Village, the latter a popular spot for Chinese food for nearly 40 years until being hit by a fire in 2018 and never reopening.

Get New England news, weather forecasts and entertainment stories to your inbox. Sign up for NECN newsletters.

The people behind Zomsa did a nice job of renovating the space, which has multiple sections, including a comfortable seating area for people waiting for a table or takeout to the left complete with couches and sofas; a modern-looking bar with a few seats in the middle; and a separate dining room to the right with bench seats and both round and square tables. Attractive hanging lights are set up throughout the restaurant, and large windows allow extra light in while also helping make for a bit of people-watching along Mass. Ave.

The restaurant considers itself a South Asian dining spot, so it’s not just Nepali food. There are plenty of familiar (and not-so familiar) Indian dishes, but the Nepali fare stands out when compared to the many Indian eateries in the northwest suburbs.

PHOTOS: Great Nepali street food in the Boston suburbs

The menu at Zomsa’s street food section features some very interesting options, including momos – dumplings with a relatively thick but soft wrapper that is crimped and pleated, looking vaguely like Chinese soup dumplings. Momos do not have broth inside them. Rather, they’re stuffed with meat and/or vegetables, and in the case of those offered at Zomsa, they can be ordered with chicken, pork, lamb or veggies.

The restaurant has three momo options: Steamed, with a hearty sauce with a variety of spices; sauteed with veggies and sauce; and as a soup. The simple steamed pork momos are a highlight, stuffed to the gills with pork. The sauce has just a slight kick but not so much that it detracts from the dumplings themselves.

Other options for street food include fried rice, chop suey, marinated chicken sizzlers and chatpate, which involves puffed rice, vegetables, cilantro and a mix of spices and lemon juice.

Much of the rest of the menu at Zomsa includes items you might find in an Indian restaurant, though with a few other Nepali options that might not be seen on Indian menus, including a spicy and aromatic soup with Tibetan origins called thukpa; tareko kukhura, which is breaded fried chicken in Himalayan spices; and newari bara, or savory lentil pancakes.

Some of the appetizers and meals often ordered at Indian dining spots are marvelous here, including the paneer pakoras, which are deep-fried fritters with a mild cheese and just the right amount of salt on the outside; a classic chicken tikka masala that can be ordered mild, moderate or hot and which comes with diced meat, rice and a creamy sauce; and palak paneer, which comes with cheese, a creamy spinach curry and rice.

Tandoori chicken, lamb, salmon and shrimp are also available, as are various breads (roti, paratha, naan, poori). Meals include papadum lentil crisps with assorted chutneys.

Zomsa does have a full liquor license, so those who dine in can choose from various beers, wines and spirits, while the menu also includes a Himalayan masala tea, and desserts include Indian doughnuts along with tres leches.

Early impressions of Zomsa Restaurant and Bar are very positive, and the dining spot is one of two new places in Arlington that have gotten noticed by food lovers in and around Boston (the other one being Quilo's Taqueria down the street in East Arlington, which had lines around the block when it first opened).

There have been some ebbs and flows with the Arlington dining scene over the years — including during the pandemic, which saw the closings of such places as Sabzi, Tango, Twyrl and Common Ground — but things seem to be looking up once again for this Boston suburb, and Zomsa certainly appears to be a part of that with its delicious food, friendly service, laid-back atmosphere and reasonable prices.
translated: आर्लिंगटन में भोजनक दृश्य वर्षों सं काफी बदलि गेल अछि.कहियो मुख्य रूप सं अपन ग्रीक पिज़्ज़ा हाउस आ टेकआउट चीनी भोजनक लेल जानल जाइत अछि, आब ई एकटा एहन शहर अछि जाहि में विभिन्न प्रकारक व्यंजनक विकल्प काफी अछि.सचमुच, जखन कि एहि बोस्टन उपनगर मे हाई-एंड डाइनिंग या डेस्टिनेशन स्पॉट के रास्ता में बेसी किछु नहिं होयत, ई निश्चित रूप सं एकटा एहन समुदाय अछि जे उत्कृष्ट भोजनालय सं भरल अछि जे बैंक के नहिं तोड़त, जाहि में अत्यधिक सम्मानित मैक्सिकन, भारतीय, वियतनामी, ग्रीक, सहित कोरियाई, इतालवी, तुर्की, थाई, लेबनानी आ जापानी भोजनालय।आब, आर्लिंगटन में एकटा रेस्टोरेंट अछि जाहि में नेपाली किराया अछि: ज़ोमसा रेस्टोरेंट आ बार.ई सस्ता स्ट्रीट फूड के लेल एकटा आओर स्थानीय विकल्प अछि जे पहिने सं बकाया व्यंजन के संग अपन नाम बनाबय लागल अछि.ज़ोमसा पहिल बेर अप्रैल मे खुजल छल, शहरक केंद्र मे जगह मे आबि गेल छल जे ताइपे टोक्यो मे घर छल आ, ताहि सं पहिने, शंघाई गाम, बाद वाला लगभग 40 साल धरि चीनी भोजनक लेल एकटा लोकप्रिय स्थान छल जा धरि कि 2018 मे आगि सं टकराएल नहि गेल छल. आ कहियो फेरसँ नहि अनेक खंड छैक, जाहिमें सोफा आ सोफाक संग पूर्णतः बामा दिस टेबुल वा टेकआउटक प्रतीक्षामें बैसल लोकक लेल आरामदायक बैसबाक स्थान सेहो छल ;एकटा आधुनिक दिखय बला बार जाहि में बीच में किछु सीट;आ दाहिना दिस अलग पिज़्ज़ा?यहाँ एक सही मायने में एक महान छिपलऽ रत्न ज़ोमसा केरऽ स्ट्रीट फूड सेक्शन केरऽ मेनू म॑ कुछ बहुत रोचक विकल्प छै, जेकरा म॑ मोमोस शामिल छै – एक अपेक्षाकृत मोटऽ लेकिन सॉफ्ट रैपर के साथ पकौड़ी जेकरा म॑ क्रिम्प आरू प्लीट करलऽ गेलऽ छै, जे चीनी सूप पकौड़ी जैसनऽ अस्पष्ट नजर आबी रहलऽ छै ।मोमोस के भीतर शोरबा नै छै।बल्कि, मांस आ/या तरकारी सं भरल छै, आ ज़ोमसा मे पेश कैल गेल कें मामला मे, ओकरा चिकन, पोर्क, मेमना या वेजीज सं मंगायल जा सकय छै.रेस्टोरेंटमें तीन टा मोमो विकल्प छैक : भापमें, अनेक प्रकारक मसालाबला हार्दिक चटनीक संग ;वेजीज आ सॉसक संग सॉटेड;आ सूपक रूपमे।साधारण भाप सं भरल पोर्क मोमोस एकटा हाइलाइट अछि, जे पोर्क सं गिल्स सं भरल अछि.चटनी मे बस हल्का किक होइत छैक मुदा एतेक नहि जे स्वयं पकौड़ी सँ हटि जाइत छैक ।स्ट्रीट फूड केरऽ अन्य विकल्पऽ म॑ फ्राइड राइस, चॉप सुय, मैरिनेट चिकन सिज़लर आरू चैटपेट शामिल छै, जेकरा म॑ पफदार चावल, सब्जी, सिलेन्ट्रो आरू मसाला आरू नींबू के रस के मिश्रण शामिल छै ।ज़ोमसामें बहुत रास मेनूमें एकटा भारतीय रेस्टोरेंटमें भेटत, यद्यपि किछु आओर नेपाली विकल्पक संग जे भारतीय मेनूमें नहिं देखल जा सकैत अछि, जाहिमें तिब्बती मूलक संग एकटा मसालेदार आ सुगंधित सूप सेहो शामिल अछि जकरा थूकपा कहल जाइत छैक ;तारेको कुखुरा, जे हिमालयन मसाला में ब्रेडेड फ्राइड चिकन छै;आ नवारी बारा, वा स्वादिष्ट मसूरक पैनकेक।भारतीय भोजनक स्थान पर प्रायः मंगाओल गेल किछु एपेटाइज़र आ भोजन एतय अद्भुत अछि, जाहि में पनीर पकोरा सेहो अछि, जे गहींर पनीर आ बाहरक ठीक सही मात्रा में गहरा तड़ल फ्रिटर्स थिक ;एकटा क्लासिक चिकन टिक्का मसाला जेकरा हल्का, मध्यम वा गरम मंगाओल जा सकैत अछि आ जे पासायुक्त मांस, चाउर आ मलाईदार चटनी सं अबैत अछि ;आ पक पनीर, जे पनीर, मलाईदार पालक करी आ चावल के संग अबैत अछि ।तंडूरी चिकन, मेमना, सामन आ झींगा सेहो उपलब्ध अछि, संगहि विभिन्न रोटी (रोटी, परथा, नान, पूरी) सेहो उपलब्ध अछि ।भोजन में पपडम मसूर के कुरकुरे के साथ असॉर्टेड चटनी शामिल छै.ज़ोमसा केरऽ पूरा शराब लाइसेंस जरूर छै, ई लेली जे लोग भोजन करै छै, वू विभिन्न बियर, वाइन आरू स्प्रिट स॑ चुनी सकै छै, जबकि मेनू म॑ हिमालयन मसाला चाय भी शामिल छै, आरू मिठाई म॑ तीस लेचेस के साथ भारतीय डोनट भी शामिल छै ।ज़ॉम्बा रेस्टोरेंट आ बार के प्रारंभिक छाप बहुत सकारात्मक अछि, आ भोजनक स्थान आर्लिंगटन के दू टा नव जगह में सं एक अछि जाहि पर बोस्टन आ आसपास के भोजन प्रेमी सब के ध्यान गेल अछि (दोसर क्विलो के टैकेरिया के ईस्ट आर्लिंगटन के सड़क पर, जे छल, जे छल. ब्लॉक के चारू कात लाइन जखन ओ पहिल बेर खुजल)।वर्षों के दौरान आर्लिंगटन डाइनिंग सीन के साथ कुछ उतार-चढ़ाव आरू प्रवाह होय गेलऽ छै — जेकरा म॑ महामारी के दौरान भी शामिल छेलै, जेकरा म॑ सब्जी, टैंगो, ट्वाइरल आरू आम जमीन जैसनऽ जगह के बंद होय के बात देखलऽ गेलऽ छेलै — लेकिन ई बोस्टन लेली एक बार फेरू चीजऽ के खोज होय रहलऽ नजर आबी रहलऽ छै । उपनगर, आरू ज़ोमसा निश्चित रूप स॑ ओकरऽ स्वादिष्ट भोजन, दोस्ताना सेवा, लेट-बैक वातावरण आरू उचित दाम के साथ एकरऽ हिस्सा प्रतीत होय छै ।

title: Nepal's Lamichhane to miss T20 World Cup after US visa denial - Stabroek News
description: Nepal's Lamichhane to miss T20 World Cup after US visa denial  Stabroek News
publisher.title: Stabroek News
full_article:
(Reuters) – Nepal leg-spinner Sandeep Lamichhane will miss the Twenty20 World Cup after a second visa application to the U.S. was rejected, the Cricket Association of Nepal (CAN) said.

Lamichhane, who last week said he had an earlier visa application rejected and was also denied a U.S. visa in 2019, will be unable to travel to the tournament in the U.S. and West Indies.

Lamichhane was suspended as Nepal captain in 2022 and taken into custody after police issued an arrest warrant for him over an assault of an 18-year-old woman.

He was found guilty of rape in December 2023 and sentenced to eight years in jail in January but cleared of the charges by an appeal court in Nepal earlier this month.

“We would like to inform that the U.S. Embassy has inability to give travel permission (visa) to national player Sandeep Lamichhane to play the World Cup,” CAN said in a statement on Thursday.

The 23-year-old is the only player from the Himalayan country to take part in prominent Twenty20 leagues in India, Australia, Pakistan and the West Indies.

Nepal begin their World Cup campaign with a match against the Netherlands on June 4, before facing Sri Lanka, South Africa and Bangladesh in Group D.
translated: (र्यूटर) – नेपाल एसोसिएशन ऑफ नेपाल (सीएएन) न॑ कहलकै कि नेपाल केरऽ लेग-स्पिनर सैंडीप लामिचने क॑ अमेरिका म॑ वीजा केरऽ दूसरऽ आवेदन क॑ खारिज करी देलऽ गेलऽ छेलै, ई बात के बाद टी-20 विश्वकप म॑ चूक जैतै ।पिछला सप्ताह न॑ कहलकै कि हुनका न॑ पहल॑ वीजा आवेदन खारिज करी देल॑ छेलै आरू २०१९ म॑ अमेरिकी वीजा स॑ भी इनकार करलऽ गेलऽ छेलै, ई बात क॑ अमेरिका आरू वेस्टइंडीज म॑ टूर्नामेंट म॑ नै जाय सकै छै ।18 वर्षीय महिला पर हमला के कारण पुलिस हुनका गिरफ्तारी वारंट जारी करला के बाद 2022 मे 2022 मे नेपाल कप्तान के रूप मे लामिखाने के निलंबित क देल गेल।दिसंबर 2023 म॑ हुनका साथ बलात्कार के दोषी ठहरालऽ गेलऽ छेलै आरू जनवरी म॑ आठ साल के जेल के सजा सुनवाय देलऽ गेलऽ छेलै लेकिन ई महीना के शुरू म॑ नेपाल केरऽ एगो अपीलीय अदालत द्वारा आरोपऽ क॑ खाली करी देलऽ गेलऽ छेलै ।कैन न॑ गुरुवार क॑ जारी बयान म॑ कहलकै कि हम्में ई सूचित करना चाहै छियै कि अमेरिकी दूतावास क॑ राष्ट्रीय खिलाड़ी संदीप लामिचने क॑ विश्व कप खेलै लेली यात्रा के अनुमति (वीजा) नै दै के छै ।23 वर्षीय खिलाड़ी हिमालयी देश केरऽ एकमात्र खिलाड़ी छै जे भारत, ऑस्ट्रेलिया, पाकिस्तान आरू वेस्टइंडीज केरऽ प्रमुख टी-20 लीग म॑ भाग लै छै ।नेपाल न॑ 4 जून क॑ नीदरलैंड के खिलाफ मैच स॑ अपनऽ विश्व कप अभियान के शुरुआत करलकै, जेकरा बाद श्रीलंका, दक्षिण अफ्रीका आरू बंगलादेश के सामना समूह डी म॑ छै ।
label: Sports

title: Book Review | How India, Nepal let each other down - The Asian Age
description: Book Review | How India, Nepal let each other down  The Asian Age
publisher.title: The Asian Age
full_article:
Among all its neighbours in South Asia, India perhaps enjoys the most unique relationship with Nepal. But it is also a history of sharp fluctuations. The open border, based on the treaty of peace and friendship and longstanding people-to-people contacts of kinship and culture have allowed not only free movement of people and goods but also for millions of Nepali citizens to live and work in India. Yet, deep distrust and misunderstanding has often come to the fore. In recent years, China’s growing footsteps in Nepal has only complicated matters.

Kathmandu Chronicle: Reclaiming India-Nepal Relations, a new book co-authored by ex-diplomat K.V. Rajan and policy professional Atul K. Thakur, marries the diplomatic skills and experience of the former Indian ambassador to Nepal with the latter’s fieldwork and independent research. It also successfully unravels the many factors that have beleaguered this relationship.

(adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});

The book covers the past seven decades. It spans King Tribhuvan’s dramatic escape to India, strains in bilateral relations under Mahendra’s monarchy as India pursued its “twin pillar” strategy to deal with the king as well as democratically elected leaders, the Indian Airlines aircraft IC-814’s hijack from Kathmandu, progress in India-Nepal relations under King Birendra until his brutal murder in the palace massacre, the rise of the Maoists and the abolition of monarchy, ending in the conversion of the erstwhile Hindu kingdom into a republic.

“There was a certain haste with which a few bureaucrats pushed Nepal’s political parties to end the monarchy,” writes Rajan in his account of the fast-paced events in the book. Though the authors are critical of past political leaderships and their policies, they conclude on a hopeful note, especially on the current decision of Delhi to raise the economic stakes of Kathmandu and make it a part of India’s growth story.

(adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});

The book’s candid admission of the flaws in past policies and objective analysis may allow it to find space in the bookshelves of those who remain interested in strong bilateral ties between India and Nepal.

Kathmandu Chronicle

By K.V. Rajan and Atul K. Thakur

Penguin

pp. 258; Rs 499
translated: दक्षिण एशिया केरऽ अपनऽ सब पड़ोसी देशऽ म॑ भारत शायद नेपाल के साथ सबसें विशिष्ट संबंध के आनंद लै छै ।मुदा ई तीक्ष्ण उतार-चढ़ावक इतिहास सेहो अछि ।शांति आरू दोस्ती के संधि आरू लंबा समय स॑ चलै वाला लोगऽ के रिश्तेदारी आरू संस्कृति के संपर्क के बारे म॑ खुला सीमा न॑ न सिर्फ लोगऽ आरू सामान केरऽ स्वतंत्र आवागमन के अनुमति देल॑ छै बल्कि लाखों नेपाली नागरिकऽ लेली भारत म॑ रहना आरू काम करै के अनुमति देल॑ छै ।तइयो गहींर अविश्वास आ गलतफहमी प्रायः सोझाँ आबि गेल अछि ।हाल के साल में चीन के नेपाल में बढ़ैत कदम के कारण सिर्फ मामला के जटिल बना देल गेल अछि.काठमांडू क्रॉनिकल: रिक्लेमिंग इंडिया-नेपाल रिलेशंस, पूर्व-डिप्लोमैट केवी राजन आरू नीति पेशेवर अतुल के ठाकुर केरऽ सह-लेखक एगो नया पुस्तक, नेपाल केरऽ पूर्व भारतीय राजदूत केरऽ कूटनीतिक कौशल आरू अनुभव स॑ बाद केरऽ फील्डवर्क आरू स्वतंत्र शोध के साथ शादी करै छै ।संगहि एहि संबंध कए घेरने अनेक कारक कए सेहो सफलतापूर्वक उजागर करैत अछि ।(AdsbyGoogle = विंडो.अद्सबगूगल || []).पुश ({});एहि पोथी मे पिछला सात दशक मे शामिल अछि।ई भारत के लेल राजा त्रिभुवन के नाटकीय पलायन, महेन्द्र के राजतंत्र के तहत द्विपक्षीय संबंध में तनाव के रूप में फैलल अछि जेना कि भारत राजा के साथ-साथ लोकतांत्रिक रूप स निर्वाचित नेता, भारतीय विमान सेवा विमान आईसी-814 के अपृष्टि के title: 'We feel erased': Nepal's asexual community vie for visibility in queer spaces - South China Morning Post
description: 'We feel erased': Nepal's asexual community vie for visibility in queer spaces  South China Morning Post
publisher.title: South China Morning Post
full_article:
Asexuality is the absence of sexual attraction with little interest in sexual activities, while aromanticism is a lack of romantic attraction or longing to form romantic relationships. However, both sexual orientations have a desire for platonic and emotionally intimate relationships.

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"ImageObject","caption":"Manita Newa Khadgi at the headquarters for Nepali Aspecs community. Photo: Bibek Bhandari","url":"https://cdn.i-scmp.com/sites/default/files/d8/images/canvas/2024/05/31/642f5f5b-121b-438d-82c4-5613e8fd961c_80bf8028.jpg"} Manita Newa Khadgi at the headquarters for Nepali Aspecs community. Photo: Bibek Bhandari

Nepal has been touted as a beacon for queer rights in Asia and is among the few countries granting sexual minorities equal protection in the constitution. Last year, the country’s top court issued an interim order allowing queer individuals to register their nuptials in government offices until a marriage equality law is passed.

But some rights advocates claim Nepal’s queer movement is not entirely inclusive, with the asexual community demanding to claim its space.

When not working as a doctor, Khadgi often gathers their team at the ground floor of their house in Kathmandu, which is also the headquarters for Nepali Aspecs. It is covered with pride flags, has literature on asexuality, and a blackboard scribbled with the group’s agenda – to be a welcoming place for people to share experiences and plan their advocacy works.

Khadgi is passionate when speaking and does not mince words, accusing many queer rights advocates of tokenising the asexual community only when discussing intersectionality and inclusivity. They says aphobia is prevalent mostly in the queer community because asexual and aromantic people “decentre romance and sex” that is seen as a key part of queer culture.

“Queerness is seen as something so rooted psychologically in people in terms of sexual and romantic attraction that asexuality and aromanticism fundamentally sound opposite of what queerness stands for,” Khadgi says.

“Queers know what it means to be ostracised and not being understood, how does that translate to you not trying to include others?”

“It’s not that we don’t feel acknowledged, we feel erased,” they say.

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"VideoObject","contentUrl":"https://www.youtube.com/embed/F9LHPU8tVcU?wmode=transparent&jqoemcache=UdCOW&enablejsapi=1&playsinline=1","description":"Thailand’s lower house of parliament approves bill recognising same-sex marriage","duration":"PT2M33S","embedUrl":"https://www.scmp.com/week-asia/lifestyle-culture/article/3264865/we-feel-erased-nepals-asexual-community-vie-visibility-queer-spaces","name":"Thailand’s lower house of parliament approves bill recognising same-sex marriage","thumbnailUrl":["https://cdn.i-scmp.com/sites/default/files/d8/video/thumbnail/2024/03/28/CLEAN---thumbnail.jpg","https://cdn.i-scmp.com/sites/default/files/styles/wide_landscape/public/d8/video/thumbnail/2024/03/28/CLEAN---thumbnail.jpg?itok=cF0qf855","https://cdn.i-scmp.com/sites/default/files/styles/768x768/public/d8/video/thumbnail/2024/03/28/CLEAN---thumbnail.jpg?itok=Hff1qo8v"],"uploadDate":"2024-06-01T11:00:13.000Z"} {"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"ImageObject","url":"https://cdn.i-scmp.com/sites/default/files/styles/wide_landscape/public/d8/video/thumbnail/2024/03/28/CLEAN---thumbnail.jpg?itok=cF0qf855"} 02:33 Thailand’s lower house of parliament approves bill recognising same-sex marriage Thailand’s lower house of parliament approves bill recognising same-sex marriage

The messages Khadgi initially received on Instagram showed a lack of understanding about asexuality in absence of wider visibility. They said people not knowing about the label made them “pathologise themselves, feeling alienated and dehumanised.”

“I spent so much of my life not knowing and not understanding,” Khadgi says, tearing up. “I can’t fathom that every moment that I am not doing anything, thousands of other people are suffering not knowing about themselves.”

The community has helped several people questioning their sexual orientation or seeking acceptance. While one group member said becoming a part of Nepali Aspecs has been “validating and healing”, another said it has helped “to self-explore and discover how I viewed the world was not wrong”.

A 23-year-old, who wished to be called Brownie and identifies on the asexuality spectrum, said they instantly felt accepted in the Aspecs group as it was “more community-focused than activism oriented”.

“When you go to other queer groups, it feels you’re going to a certain camp and need to fit in – you feel like an outsider,” Brownie says. “I never felt that here.”

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"ImageObject","caption":"Nepali Aspecs members meet for their first offline event in Kathmandu, holding an asexual flag to mark International Asexuality Day in 2022. Photo: Handout","url":"https://cdn.i-scmp.com/sites/default/files/d8/images/canvas/2024/05/31/d2d79da9-435e-4e5b-8ece-2964cc3e73c8_987b2a26.jpg"} Nepali Aspecs members meet for their first offline event in Kathmandu, holding an asexual flag to mark International Asexuality Day in 2022. Photo: Handout

Madhurima Bhadra, a gender and public health educator, agreed there is a siloing of different identities in the queer spectrum in Nepal, which she says is detrimental to the overall movement. Many queer organisations are competing for funds from international donor agencies and visibility, which likely leads to a gap in whose voice is heard more prominently, she says.

“To address these inequalities and lack of cohesion would require a change in thought and ideology that everyone in the LGBTQIA community is equally important, and if one group is more marginalised than it holds the whole community back,” Bhadra said.

“The LGBTQIA movement should not be about which organisation is doing what for whom, but rather about what they are collectively doing for the entire community.”

Khadgi and their team are trying to change such thoughts, both online and offline.

On Instagram, Nepali Aspecs aims to provide accurate information on asexuality and aromanticism, along with different identities within the spectra, which is largely missing in Nepal and elsewhere.

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"ImageObject","caption":"Members of the LGBTQ community at a rally in Kathmandu. Photo: Shutterstock","url":"https://cdn.i-scmp.com/sites/default/files/d8/images/canvas/2024/05/31/bafb0e53-8132-4caf-90c4-eafea3e2005d_df26de69.jpg"} Members of the LGBTQ community at a rally in Kathmandu. Photo: Shutterstock

Khadgi says it is important to realise that love can exist without attraction, and many asexual and aromantic people are seeking platonic partnerships without forcing romance and sex into them.

“It is a legitimate and fulfilling way of existing for us,” they say.

The Nepali Aspecs community aims to amplify that message. Ahead of Pride month in June, the community is hosting pre-Pride hang-outs, a series of events and interaction programmes to assert their place in the queer movement and become visible to more people on the asexual and aromantic spectrum who might be in search of a community.

“To find out about oneself is the first step, and so many people don’t know that,” Khadgi says. “I created this group out of compulsion because I was desperate to find another Nepali asexual person. But every time a new person comes to us now, it feels magical.”

“Just four years ago, I thought asexual people did not even exist in Nepal and if I were the only one,” Khadgi said. “Now we have a community.”
translated: अलैंगिकता यौन गतिविधि में कम रुचि के साथ यौन आकर्षण के अभाव छै, जबकि सुगंधितता रोमांटिक आकर्षण के कमी या रोमांटिक संबंध बनाबै के लालसा छै.तथापि, दुनू यौन अभिविन्यास मे प्लेटोक आ भावनात्मक रूप सँ अंतरंग संबंधक इच्छा होइत छैक ।{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"imageobject"," कैबेशन": "नेपाली aspecs समुदाय के लिए मुख्यालय में मनता नवा खदगी. फोटो: बिबेक भंडारी","यूआरएल" :"https://cdn.i-scmp.com/sites/default/files/d8/images/canvas/2024/05/31/642f5f5b-121b-438d-438d-82c4-5613e8fd9628028028028028.8028.8028.8028.8028028028028028.9613. नेपाली एएसपीईसीएस समुदाय के लिये मुख्यालय।फोटो : बिबेक भंडारी नेपाल क॑ एशिया म॑ क्वीयर राइट्स केरऽ बीकन के रूप म॑ प्रचारित करलऽ गेलऽ छै आरू संविधान म॑ यौन अल्पसंख्यक समान सुरक्षा प्रदान करै वाला कुछ देशऽ म॑ शामिल छै ।पिछला साल देश केरऽ शीर्ष न्यायालय न॑ एगो अंतरिम आदेश जारी करलकै जेकरा स॑ विचित्र व्यक्ति सिनी क॑ अपनऽ विवाह समानता कानून पारित होय तलक सरकारी कार्यालयऽ म॑ अपनऽ विवाह दर्ज करै के अनुमति देलऽ गेलऽ छेलै ।लेकिन कुछ अधिकार के पक्षधर दावा करै छै कि नेपाल के विचित्र आंदोलन पूर्ण रूप स॑ समावेशी नै छै, जेकरा म॑ अलैंगिक समुदाय अपनऽ अंतरिक्ष के दावा करै के मांग करै छै ।जखन डाक्टर के रूप में काज नै करै छै त खाद्गी अक्सर काठमांडू में अपनऽ घर के भूतल पर अपनऽ टीम इकट्ठा करै छै, जे नेपाली एस्पेक के मुख्यालय भी छै ।एकरा प्राइड झंडा स॑ ढकलऽ छै, अलैंगिकता के बारे म॑ साहित्य छै, आरू समूह केरऽ एजेंडा के साथ एक ब्लैकबोर्ड स्क्रिबल छै – जेकरा स॑ लोगऽ लेली अनुभव साझा करै आरू अपनऽ वकालत के काम के योजना बनाबै लेली एगो स्वागत योग्य जगह बनी जाय छै ।खद्गी बोलै के समय भावुक छै आरू शब्दऽ के कीमा नै करै छै, जेकरा म॑ बहुत विचित्र अधिकार के पक्षधरऽ प॑ अलैंगिक समुदाय के टोकन करै के आरोप लगै छै जब॑ इंटरसेक्शनलिटी आरू समावेशी के चर्चा करलऽ जाय छै ।हुनकऽ कहना छै कि अफोबिया अधिकतर विचित्र समुदाय म॑ प्रचलित छै, कैन्हेंकि अलैंगिक आरू सुगंधित लोगऽ क॑ “विकेन्द्र रोमांस आरू सेक्स” छै जेकरा क्वीयर संस्कृति केरऽ एगो प्रमुख अंग के रूप म॑ देखलऽ जाय छै ।खद्गी कहै छै, “विक्रय क॑ यौन आरू रोमांटिक आकर्षण के दृष्टि स॑ लोगऽ म॑ मनोवैज्ञानिक रूप स॑ एतना जड़ के रूप म॑ देखलऽ जाय छै जेकरा लेली विचित्रता के खड़ा होय के बात के विपरीत अलैंगिकता आरू सुगंधितता के विपरीत ध्वनितता छै ।“क्वीयर के पता छै कि बहिष्कार नै करलऽ जाय आरू समझै के की मतलब छै, वू कोना अनुवाद करै छै कि आपने दोसरऽ क॑ शामिल करै के कोशिश नै करै छै?”ओ सब कहैत छथि जे एहन नहि अछि जे हम सब स्वीकार नहि महसूस करैत छी, हमरा सब कए मेटाएल महसूस होइत रहलऽ छै ।ओ सब कहैत छथि जे हमरा सब लेल ई एकटा वैध आ पूर्ण रूप स विद्यमान तरीका अछि।नेपाली एएसपीईसीएस समुदाय कें उद्देश्य ओय संदेश कें प्रवर्धित करनाय छै.जून म॑ प्राइड महीना स॑ पहल॑, समुदाय प्री-प्राइड हैंग-आउट के आयोजन करी रहलऽ छै, जे विचित्र आंदोलन म॑ अपनऽ जगह क॑ दृढ़ करै लेली आरू अलैंगिक आरू अरोमंटिक स्पेक्ट्रम प॑ अधिक लोगऽ क॑ दिखाई दै छै जे खोज म॑ हो सकै छै, के एक श्रृंखला के आयोजन आरू बातचीत कार्यक्रम के आयोजन करी रहलऽ छै । एक समुदाय के।खद्गी कहैत छथि, “अपना के बारे में पता लगाबय लेल पहिल डेग अछि, आ एतेक लोक के ई बात नहिं बुझल छनि.”ओ कहला जे हम एहि समूह कए मजबूरी स बाहर निकाललहुं, किया कि हम एकटा आओर नेपाली अलैंगिक व्यक्ति कए खोजबा लेल बेताब छलहुं।मुदा हर बेर कोनो नव व्यक्ति आब हमरा सब लग अबैत अछि, त' ओ जादुई बुझाइत अछि।”खदगी कहलनि जे, एखनहि चारि साल पहिने हमरा लागल जे नेपाल मे अलैंगिक लोक सेहो नहि अछि आ जौं हमहीं टा रहितहुं।“आब हमरा सभक एकटा समुदाय अछि।”

title: One of the accused in the murder of Bangladesh MP Anwarul Azim Anar arrested in Nepal - Myrepublica
description: One of the accused in the murder of Bangladesh MP Anwarul Azim Anar arrested in Nepal  Myrepublica
publisher.title: Myrepublica
full_article:
KATHMANDU, June 1: A Bangladeshi citizen accused in the murder case of Bangladeshi MP Anwarul Azim Anar has been arrested in Nepal.

A Bangladeshi citizen named Mohammad Siyam Hussain was arrested by Nepal Police at Tribhuvan International Airport on Thursday, according to highly-placed police sources.

Bangladeshi MP Anar was assassinated on May 22 in Calcutta, India.

Reports indicate that some individuals from India have been arrested in connection with his murder, while other suspects remain at large. According to Indian media outlets, three people from Bangladesh and one from Calcutta have been arrested in connection with the murder.

The other four accused—Shaheen, Siam, Faizal, and Mustafizur—are still missing, while Mohammad Siam Hussain has been arrested in Nepal.
translated: काठमांडू, १ जून : बंगलादेशी सांसद अनवारुल अजीम अनार केरऽ हत्या के मामला म॑ बांग्लादेशी नागरिक क॑ नेपाल म॑ गिरफ्तार करी लेलऽ गेलऽ छै ।उच्च स्थान वाला पुलिस सूत्रऽ के अनुसार गुरुवार क॑ गुरुवार क॑ मोहम्मद सियाम हुसैन नाम केरऽ एगो बंगलादेशी नागरिक क॑ नेपाल पुलिस न॑ गिरफ्तार करी लेल॑ छै ।बांग्लादेशी सांसद अनार क हत्या 22 मई कए भारत क कलकत्ता मे भेल।खबरऽ स॑ पता चलै छै कि भारत केरऽ कुछ व्यक्ति क॑ हुनकऽ हत्या के मामला म॑ गिरफ्तार करी लेलऽ गेलऽ छै, जबकि कुछ संदिग्ध लोगऽ क॑ मोटा-मोटी छै ।भारतीय मीडिया आउटलेट के अनुसार बांग्लादेश के तीन लोग आरू कलकत्ता के एक व्यक्ति के हत्या के मामला में गिरफ्तार करलऽ गेलऽ छै ।अन्य चारि आरोपी-शहिन, सियाम, फैजल, आ मुस्ताफिजुर- एखनो लापता अछि, जखन कि मोहम्मद सियाम हुसैन केँ नेपाल मे गिरफ्तार कयल गेल अछि।
label: Entertainment

title: Adam Gilchrist handpicks Nepal, Netherlands to ‘ruffle a few feathers’ at T20 World Cup - WION
description: Adam Gilchrist handpicks Nepal, Netherlands to ‘ruffle a few feathers’ at T20 World Cup  WION
publisher.title: WION
full_article:
Former Australia opener and batting great Adam Gilchrist feels associate nations like Nepal and Netherlands could surprise some top teams in the upcoming 2024 T20 World Cup in the Americas. Gilchrist feels with the emergence of franchise-based T20 Leagues worldwide, players from non-Test playing countries have gained unparalleled exposure and confidence, which they can bring to the bigger stage like this tournament.

Nepal and Netherlands are placed in Group D alongside South Africa, Bangladesh and Sri Lanka, and Gilchrist feels the most exciting games will come out of that group. Adding that some of the players from Nepal are plying their trades in top leagues worldwide, and can come in handy.

“I think Nepal would be a team that might be able to fire a shot,” Gilchrist told SEN Radio on Saturday. “They’ve got a couple of young players who have been in all the big leagues for a number of years now.”

ALSO READ: India’s Dinesh Karthik retires from professional cricket, pens heartfelt note

Speaking of the Netherlands, who has a history of producing mighty upsets in this tournament, Gilly said they could ruffle a few feathers like the previous edition, where they beat South Africa and knocked them out of the semi-final race.

Be it their win over England at the Lord’s in the 2009 edition to beating Ireland in the match of the tournament in 2014, the Dutch have always been a side to look out for.

“The Dutch always seem to ruffle a few feathers, they always seem to get under the skin, and they’re drawn in the same pool as South Africa again. They nailed them in the T20 World Cup last time in Australia in Adelaide. So, it might be the Dutch,” Gilchrist continued.

Gilly wary of threat from everywhere

Also shedding some light on the USA’s unexpected T20I series win over Bangladesh, Gilchrist said every team will bring something to the table and that none could be taken for granted.

“That’s in a financial component where they get a little bit of a lick of the ice cream… but also just the experience. With the T20 format, that’s the opportunity for these nations to come in and start trying to ruffle a few feathers but also bed down the cricket programs in their countries.

“Have a look at the results of the USA against Bangladesh in the last few weeks, the US have fired a few shots, they’ve beaten them a few times. It’s about allowing them to get a platform and a chance to shine. Hopefully that firms up the cricket programs in more nations around the world. Both the teams face each other on Tuesday to begin their campaign in the T20 global showpiece,” Gilchrist concluded.
translated: ऑस्ट्रेलिया केरऽ पूर्व ओपनर आरू बल्लेबाजी करै वाला ग्रेट एडम गिलक्रिस्ट न॑ लगै छै कि नेपाल आरू नीदरलैंड जैसनऽ सहयोगी राष्ट्र अमेरिका म॑ आबै वाला 2024 टी-20 विश्व कप म॑ कुछ शीर्ष टीमऽ क॑ आश्चर्यचकित करी सकै छै ।गिलक्रिस्ट क॑ दुनिया भर म॑ फ्रेंचाइजी आधारित टी-२० लीग केरऽ उदय के साथ महसूस होय छै, गैर-परीक्षण खेलै वाला देशऽ के खिलाड़ी न॑ बेजोड़ एक्सपोजर आरू आत्मविश्वास हासिल करलकै, जेकरा वू ई टूर्नामेंट जैसनऽ बड़ऽ मंच प॑ लानी सकै छै ।नेपाल आरू नीदरलैंड क॑ दक्षिण अफ्रीका, बांग्लादेश आरू श्रीलंका के साथ समूह डी म॑ रखलऽ गेलऽ छै आरू गिलक्रिस्ट क॑ लगै छै कि वू समूह स॑ सबस॑ रोमांचक खेल आबै वाला छै ।आरू कहलकै कि नेपाल केरऽ कुछ खिलाड़ी दुनिया भर म॑ टॉप लीग म॑ अपनऽ ट्रेड प॑ प्लाई करी रहलऽ छै, आरू ई काम आबी सकै छै ।गिलक्रिस्ट न॑ शनिदिन सेन रेडियो स॑ कहलकै कि हमरा लगै छै कि नेपाल एगो ऐसनऽ टीम होतै जेकरा स॑ गोलीबारी होय सकै छै ।“हुनका सब के पास एक दू टा युवा खिलाड़ी छै जे एखन कतेको साल स सब पैघ लीग में छथि।”इहो पढ़ू : भारतक दिनेश कार्तिक पेशेवर क्रिकेट सं रिटायर करैत छथि, पेन हार्टलील्ट नोट नीदरलैंडक बात करैत, जिनका एहि टूर्नामेंट में शक्तिशाली परेशानी पैदा करबाक इतिहास छनि, गिली कहलनि जे ओ पिछला संस्करण जेकाँ किछु पंख कें रफल क सकैत छथि, जतय ओ दक्षिण अफ्रीका कें हराबैत छलाह आ सेमीफाइनल दौड़ स बाहर निकालि देलक।2014 म॑ टूर्नामेंट केरऽ मैच म॑ आयरलैंड क॑ हराबै लेली 2009 केरऽ संस्करण म॑ लॉर्ड्स म॑ इंग्लैंड प॑ हुनकऽ जीत, डच हमेशा स॑ देखै लेली एगो टीम रहलऽ छै ।“ डच हमेशा कुछ पंखऽ के बरकरार रखै वाला लगै छै, वू हमेशा त्वचा के नीचे मिलै छै, आरू वू फेरू दक्षिण अफ्रीका के समान पूल में खींचलऽ जाय छै ।ओ सब पिछला बेर ऑस्ट्रेलिया मे एडिलेड मे टी-20 विश्वकप मे कील ठोकि देलक।अस्तु, ई डच भ’ सकैत अछि,’ गिलक्रिस्ट आगू कहलनि.गिली स॑ सब जगह स॑ धमकी के धमकी भी बांग्लादेश प॑ अमेरिका केरऽ अप्रत्याशित टी-20आई सीरीज जीत प॑ कुछ प्रकाश डालै वाला गिलक्रिस्ट न॑ कहलकै कि हर टीम कुछ कुछ टेबुल प॑ लानै छै आरू कोय भी क॑ हल्का म॑ नै लेलऽ जाब॑ सकै छै ।“से एकटा वित्तीय घटक मे अछि जतय हुनका सभ के कनि आइसक्रीम के चाट मिलैत छनि... मुदा सिर्फ अनुभव सेहो.टी-20 प्रारूप के साथ, यही मौका छै कि ई राष्ट्रऽ के अंदर आबी क॑ कुछ पंख क॑ रफ करै के कोशिश शुरू होय जाय लेकिन अपनऽ देशऽ के क्रिकेट कार्यक्रमऽ क॑ भी बिछा देलऽ जाय ।“पिछला कुछ हफ्ता म॑ बांग्लादेश के खिलाफ अमेरिका केरऽ रिजल्ट प॑ एक नजर डालला प॑ अमेरिका न॑ कुछ शॉट फायर करी देल॑ छै, कुछ बार ओकरा हराबै छै ।ई हुनका एकटा प्लेटफार्म आ चमकय के मौका देबय के अनुमति देबय के अछि.आशा छै कि दुनिया भर के अधिक राष्ट्रऽ म॑ क्रिकेट कार्यक्रमऽ क॑ फर्मऽ म॑ फर्म करलऽ जैतै ।मंगलवार क॑ दोनों टीम एक-दूसरा के सामना करी क॑ टी-२० ग्लोबल शोपीस म॑ अपनऽ अभियान शुरू करै लेली एक-दूसरा के सामना करै छै,’’ गिलक्रिस्ट न॑ अपनऽ बात के समापन करलकै ।

title: Is China swindling Nepal over repayment of Pokhara airport loan? - The Sunday Guardian Live - The Sunday Guardian
description: Is China swindling Nepal over repayment of Pokhara airport loan? - The Sunday Guardian Live  The Sunday Guardian
publisher.title: The Sunday Guardian
full_article:
NEW DELHI : It has been claimed that China’s loan to Nepal is being serviced at 5% and not 2%, as publicly claimed by China.

Chinese Ambassador to Nepal, Chen Song, has courted controversy. He is being accused of crossing the diplomatic lines after he publicly threatened a senior journalist on X (formerly Twitter) after the said journalist claimed that the loan provided by China’s Export-Import Bank to Nepal to develop the Pokhara International Airport was being serviced by Nepal at the rate of 5% and not 2% as was being publicly claimed by Chinese authorities.

Gajendra Budhathoki, who is a financial journalist of Nepal with 29 years’ experience and a strong understanding of economic issues, on 27 May tweeted in Nepali that “The loan taken for the Pokhara International Airport was said to have an interest rate of 2 percent, but it was 5 percent.”

This immediately led to a surprising knee-jerk reaction from Song, who responded to Budhathoki while calling him a liar. “Worst lie that I ever saw. It is public information, yet you dare to lie about it,” Song wrote. The journalist, in response to the ambassador, said that “I will publish an article in his magazine with proof to show the loan was actually being charged at the rate of 5 percent.”

A belligerent Song, who was posted in Nepal in February last year, then further retorted, “If you have the document, publish it. If you don’t need time to find proof, then what kind of intention is this. Spreading lies first, then waits for the tide to subside, and spread again.”

Speaking to The Sunday Guardian, Budhatoki said that as per the official documents accessed by him related to this entire project, it is clear that the Nepali government was repaying the loan at the rate of 5%, which, if read while keeping the exchange rate in mind, would come to 36%. “The loan was signed between the Nepal government and China’s Import-Export Bank for a 2% rate of interest. As per the agreement, the loan is to be served by Civil Aviation Authority of Nepal (CAAN) directly to the Chinese bank and they are doing it at the rate of 5% for the last 7 years. Apart from the interest, CAAN is also paying a ‘Management fee at the rate of 0.2%’ and ‘commitment fee’ at the rate of 0.2%.

Please keep in mind that when the loan was signed, the exchange was 86 Nepali rupees for 1 dollar and now it is 134 Nepali rupees for 1 dollar. So in reality, the Nepali government is repaying the loan at the rate of 36%,” Budhatoki told The Sunday Guardian while stating that he will publish an article on this in the coming days.

Related documents accessed by The Sunday Guardian showed that the loan was indeed being served by Nepal at the rate of 5%.

Ever since his tweets and comments to Song that he will put out all the facts in the public domain in the coming days, Budhatoki said that he has been receiving threats from trolls and anonymous users. On 31 May, his Facebook post on the same issue that he had written in English was deleted by Facebook without any intimation.

In August 2020, the dead body of Balaram Baniya, who was the Assistant Editor of Kantipur, a national vernacular daily, was found in Makawanpur district of Nepal. He had been missing for two days. Before his death, he had reported on the encroachment and salami slicing of Nepali land that China was carrying out.

This is not the first time that the Chinese ambassador has courted controversy.

Last year in September, Song was accused of betraying his responsibilities as a diplomat and speaking like a newbie politician. While addressing a discussion in Kathmandu titled, “China in the global economy and its impact in Nepal,” Song had said: “Unfortunately, you have a neighbour like India, but fortunately you have a neighbour like India, because India is a huge market, with huge potential you can tap into. But at the same time, India’s policy towards Nepal and other neighbours is not so friendly and not so beneficial to Nepal. So, we call that policy of constraints.” Pokhara airport, for which China had given a $215.96 million loan to Nepal, was finally completed and inaugurated on 1 January 2023, after a 50-year wait for the second most populous city of Nepal. However, it has failed to take off, just like many other Belt and Road Initiatives (BRI) of China across Asia.
translated: नई दिल्ली : ई दावा करलऽ गेलऽ छै कि चीन केरऽ नेपाल क॑ ऋण केरऽ सेवा ५% पर करलऽ जाय रहलऽ छै आरू २% नै, जैसनऽ कि चीन न॑ सार्वजनिक रूप स॑ दावा करल॑ छै ।नेपाल के चीनी राजदूत चेन गीत, विवाद के कोर्ट केने छथि।उक्त पत्रकार के दावा के बाद कि चीन के निर्यात-आयाधन बैंक द्वारा नेपाल के विकास के लेल देल गेल ऋण के नेपाल द्वारा सेवा देल जा रहल अछि, एकर दावा के बाद हुनका पर कूटनीतिक लाइन पार करबाक आरोप लगाओल जा रहल अछि। 5% के दर स आ 2% नै जेना चीनी अधिकारी सब के सार्वजनिक रूप स दावा कयल जा रहल छल।गजेन्द्र बुधथोकी, जे नेपाल के वित्तीय पत्रकार छैथ जिनका 29 साल के अनुभव आ आर्थिक मुद्दा के मजबूत समझ छै, नेपाली में 27 मई के ट्वीट केने छैथ जे “पोखरा अंतर्राष्ट्रीय हवाई अड्डा के लेल लेल गेल ऋण के ब्याज दर 2 प्रतिशत के कहल गेल छल, मुदा 5 प्रतिशत छल।”एहि सँ तुरंत गीतक आश्चर्यजनक घुटना-झटक प्रतिक्रिया भेटल, जे बुधथोकी केँ झूठ बाजैत कहैत छल |“सबसँ खराब झूठ जे हम कहियो देखलहुँ।ई सार्वजनिक जानकारी अछि, तइयो अहाँ एहि पर झूठ बाजबाक हिम्मत करैत छी।'' गीत लिखलनि।पत्रकार, राजदूत केरऽ जवाब म॑ कहलकै कि “हम॑ हुनकऽ पत्रिका म॑ एगो लेख प्रकाशित करबै जेकरा स॑ प्रमाण छै कि वास्तव म॑ लोन प॑ ५ प्रतिशत के दर स॑ शुल्क लेलऽ जाय रहलऽ छै ।”एकटा युद्धरत गीत, जे पिछला साल फरवरी मे नेपाल मे पोस्ट कएल गेल छल, तखन आओर रिटोर केलक, “अगर अहां लग दस्तावेज अछि त ओकरा प्रकाशित करि देल गेल अछि.अगर प्रमाण खोजय लेल समय के जरूरत नहिं अछि त ई केहन इरादा अछि.पहिने पसारैत, फेर ज्वार-भाटाक प्रतीक्षा करैत अछि, आ फेर पसारि दैत अछि।”संडे गार्जियन सं बात करैत बुधतोकी कहलनि जे एहि पूरा परियोजना सं संबंधित हुनका द्वारा एक्सेस कयल गेल आधिकारिक दस्तावेजक अनुसार, ई स्पष्ट अछि जे नेपाली सरकार 5% के दर सं ऋण चुका रहल छल, जे, जं विनिमय दर के रखैत पढ़ल जाय तं, जं विनिमय दर के ध्यान राखब, 36% पर आबि जायत।ओ कहला जे नेपाल सरकार आ चीन क आयात-निर्यात बैंक क बीच 2% ब्याज दर पर हस्ताक्षर भेल।समझौता के अनुसार, ऋण केरऽ सेवा नेपाल (सीएएन) केरऽ नागरिक उड्डयन प्राधिकरण द्वारा सीधे चीनी बैंक क॑ करलऽ जाय आरू वू ई काम पिछला ७ साल लेली ५% के दर स॑ करी रहलऽ छै ।ब्याज के अलावा सीएएन 0.2% के दर स॑ ‘0.2% के दर स॑ 0.2% के दर स॑ प्रबंधन शुल्क’ भी द॑ रहलऽ छै ।कृपया ध्यान राखब जे जखन ऋण पर हस्ताक्षर भेल त एक्सचेंज 1 डॉलर में 86 नेपाली रुपया छल आ आब 134 नेपाली रुपया अछि।त वास्तविकता म॑ नेपाली सरकार ३६% के दर स॑ ऋण चुकाय रहलऽ छै,’’ बुधतोकी न॑ रविवार केरऽ गार्जियन क॑ बतैलकै आरू ई कहतें हुअ॑ कहलकै कि हुनी आबै वाला दिनऽ म॑ एकरा प॑ एगो लेख प्रकाशित करतै ।रविदिन गार्जियन द्वारा पहुँचल गेल संबंधित दस्तावेज मे पता चलल जे वास्तव मे नेपाल द्वारा 5% क दर स ऋण देल जा रहल अछि।जहिया स॑ हुनकऽ ट्वीट आरू टिप्पणी गीत प॑ छै कि आबै वाला दिनऽ म॑ हुनी सार्वजनिक क्षेत्र म॑ सब तथ्य क॑ बाहर निकालतै, बुधतोकी न॑ कहलकै कि हुनका ट्रोल आरू बेनामी उपयोगकर्ता स॑ धमकी मिल॑ लगलऽ छै ।31 मई कए ओही मुद्दा पर हुनकर फेसबुक पोस्ट जे ओ अंग्रेजी मे लिखने छलाह, फेसबुक द्वारा बिना कोनो संकेत के डिलीट क देल गेल।अगस्त २०२० म॑ बलाराम बनिया केरऽ मृत निकाय, जे नेपाल केरऽ मकवनपुर जिला म॑ राष्ट्रीय लोकभाषा केरऽ रोजाना कांटीपुर केरऽ सहायक संपादक छेलै ।दू दिनसँ लापता छल।अपनऽ मौत स॑ पहल॑ वू अतिक्रमण आरू सलामी केरऽ नपाली जमीन केरऽ स्लाइसिंग के बारे म॑ रिपोर्ट करी चुकलऽ छेलै जे चीन करी रहलऽ छेलै ।ई पहिल बेर नै छै कि चीनी राजदूत विवाद के कोर्ट-मटोल करै छै।पिछला साल सितंबर मे गीत पर आरोप छल जे ओ अपन जिम्मेदारी के राजनयिक के रूप मे धोखा देलक आ नवसिखुआ के राजनीतिज्ञ के तरह बाजल.काठमांडू में एकटा चर्चा के संबोधित करैत, जकर शीर्षक छल, “चाइना इन द ग्लोबल इकोनॉमी एंड इट्स इम्पैक्ट इन नेपाल,” गीत कहने छल: “दुर्भाग्यवश, अहाँक भारत सन पड़ोसी अछि, मुदा सौभाग्यवश अहाँक भारत सन पड़ोसी अछि, कारण भारत एकटा विशाल बाजार अछि , विशाल क्षमता के साथ जेकरा में अहां टैप क सकय छी.मुदा संगहि नेपाल आ अन्य पड़ोसीक प्रति भारतक नीति ओतेक मित्रवत नहि अछि आ नेपाल लेल ओतेक लाभकारी नहि अछि ।अस्तु, हम ओहि बाधाक नीति कहैत छी।”पोखरा हवाई अड्डा, जेकरा लेली चीन नेपाल क॑ 215.96 मिलियन डॉलर के ऋण देल॑ छेलै, आखिरकार 1 जनवरी 2023 क॑ 1 जनवरी 2023 क॑ उद्घाटन करलऽ गेलै, जेकरा म॑ नेपाल केरऽ दूसरऽ सबसें अधिक आबादी वाला शहर केरऽ 50 साल के इंतजार छेलै ।मुदा, ई उड़ान भरय में असफल रहल अछि, ठीक ओहिना जेना पूरा एशिया के चीन के बहुत रास अन्य बेल्ट आ सड़क पहल (BRI).

title: People in Nepal-India border areas face hardships - The Kathmandu Post
description: People in Nepal-India border areas face hardships  The Kathmandu Post
publisher.title: The Kathmandu Post
full_article:
Dilaraj Panta had taken Rs200,000 in loan from Rastriya Banijya Bank in 1998 keeping his 14 katthas of land as collateral. He repaid the loan within three years. In 2003, Panta decided to take loan again by using the same land as collateral. But Rastriya Banijya Bank refused to issue a loan this time stating that the loan could not be issued by maintaining the land as collateral. He also attempted to take a loan from other private banks but they denied it for the same reason.

Of late, various banks have set up their branches in the administrative centre of the local units. But Panta—who hails from Bhuda in Belauri Municipality-10, Kanchanpur—and many people like him are deprived of taking loans by using the land that lies near Nepal-India border as collateral.

Border disputes occur quite frequently in Bhuda area. There are border disputes in around a dozen of places in Kanchanpur district. And despite having land ownership certificates, the local residents cannot use the land for collateral for bank loans due to the border disputes. Even where there are no border disputes, the banks do not agree to issue loans by maintaining the land as collateral if the land is near the Nepal-India border.

Top Bahadur Chand of Bhuda faced a similar problem five years ago as he needed a bank loan to send his son abroad for further studies. He owned 10 katthas of land adjoining the no-man’s-land. But the government as well as private banking institutions refused to maintain the land as collateral for the loan. “I had no alternative to selling the land after the banks refused loans,” Chand said. “I needed Rs1 million. I had to sell the land at cheaper prices after I could not manage the loan.”

Like Panta and Chand, the local people living near the Nepal-India border are deprived of using their land for loan purposes. “The local people in the area are forced to borrow loans from money lenders at high interest rates as the financial institutions refuse to use our land for collateral,” Panta said. The local people urge the government authorities to ease their problem.

The Chaudhar river flows through the middle of Bhuda. The river is the natural border of two countries—eastern side is Nepal and western side is India. But the financial institutions set their own standards regarding the border for issuing loans. They do not use the land from 200 metres to one kilometre inside the Nepal-India border for collateral.

Pankaj Bhatta, manager of Nabil Bank in Belauri, said the insitution does not accept land up to 500 metres from the no-man’s-land and the criteria is even higher where there are border disputes. “The banks have their own internal directives and working guidelines,” Bhatta said. “They accept collateral only after risk evaluation.”

Nepal Bank Limited, the country’s oldest commercial bank, does not accept land within 200 metres from the no-man’s-land for collateral. “In the case of the disputed border area, we cannot use the land up to one kilometre from the border for collateral. The collateral is used based on risk evaluation,” said Mahesh Raj Joshi, manager of Mahendranagar branch of Nepal Bank Limited.

Generally, the lands that lie on the banks of the rivers or streams, lands that are not connected with roads, lands having legal complications, lands that are registered only before six months and the lands acquired by the government cannot be used as collateral for loan purposes. But the commercial banks make their own guidelines to reject the lands for collateral purposes.

Nepal Rastra Bank, the central bank of Nepal which regulates financial institutions, says that there is no such regulation regarding the land that borders with the no-man’s-land for collateral. “There are no such working guidelines that prevent using the lands adjoining Nepal-India for collateral,” said Bhagawat Acharya, assistant information officer at the Nepal Rastra Bank central office.

Not only the hassle in taking bank loans, the local people living near Nepal-India border have to endure several other problems. Seema Suraksha Bal (SSB) personnel sometimes prevent people from using the lands that they have land ownership certificates of, entering Nepali side with weapons and obstructing the carrying out development activities, among others.



Nepal and India share a 129.5-km-long border in Kanchanpur district. According to the information provided by the authorities, there are a total of 390 main, subsidiary and minor border pillars in the district. Among them, 32 pillars have gone missing while 41 pillars were damaged by the floods. Many other border pillars are in a dilapidated condition.

Due to the border disputes caused by the absence of border pillars, the local people claim that India’s SSB frequently interferes with construction activities including road construction on the Nepali side. They even create disturbances in tree plantation programmes in the community forests on the Nepali side of the border.

There are border disputes in Pyaratal to Aanandabazaar of Punarbas, Pachui and Bhuda areas of Belauri Municipality, Jhimlima of Beldadi Rural Municipality, Kutiyakbhar to Baduwatol of Dodhara Chandani Municipality and Bramhadev area of Bhumdutta Municipality in Kanchanpur.
translated: दलाराज पंता 1998 मे रस्त्रिया बानीज्य बैंक स 200,000 रुपया क उधार ल चुकल छलाह जे अपन 14टा कटथा जमीन कए जमानत क रूप मे रखैत छलाह।तीन सालक भीतर ओ ऋण चुकता केलनि।2003 मे पंता न॑ जमानत के समान जमीन के इस्तेमाल करी क॑ फेरू ऋण लेबै के फैसला करलकै ।मुदा रस्त्रिया बनीज्य बैंक एहि बेर ऋण जारी करबा स इनकार क देलक जे जमीन कए जमानत क रूप मे रखला स ऋण जारी नहि कैल जा सकैत अछि।ओ आन निजी बैंक स कर्ज लेबय के कोशिश सेहो केलनि मुदा ओ सब ओहिना एहि कारण स इनकार केलथि।देर स स्थानीय इकाइ क प्रशासनिक केंद्र मे विभिन्न बैंक अपन शाखा स्थापित केलक अछि।लेकिन पंता-जे बेलौरी नगरपालिका-१०, कनचपुर में भुदा के निवासी छै-आरू हुनका जैसनऽ बहुत लोग नेपाल-भारत के सीमा के पास पड़लऽ जमीन के उपयोग जमाय के रूप में होय के कारण ऋण लेबै स॑ वंचित छै ।भुदा क्षेत्र मे सीमा विवाद काफी बेर होइत अछि ।कानचनपुर जिला में लगभग एक दर्जन स्थान पर सीमा विवाद अछि |आरू जमीन के स्वामित्व प्रमाणपत्र के बावजूद स्थानीय निवासी सीमा विवाद के कारण बैंक ऋण लेली जमानत के लेलऽ जमीन के उपयोग नै करी सकै छै ।जतऽ सीमा विवाद नै छै, वहाँ भी बैंक जमीन क॑ जमानत के रूप म॑ रखतें हुअ॑ ऋण जारी करै लेली सहमत नै छै अगर जमीन नेपाल-भारत के सीमा के पास छै ।भूडा केरऽ शीर्ष बहादुर चंद क॑ पाँच साल पहलें भी ऐसनऽ ही समस्या के सामना करना पड़लै, कैन्हेंकि हुनका अपनऽ बेटा क॑ आगू के पढ़ाई लेली विदेश भेजै लेली बैंक ऋण के जरूरत छेलै ।नो-मैन-लैंड सँ सटल 10 टा कटथा जमीनक मालिक छलाह।मुदा सरकार क संग-संग निजी बैंकिंग संस्थान एहि जमीन कए ऋण क जमानत क रूप मे रखबा स मना करि देलक।चांद कहलनि जे, बैंक के ऋण सं मना करला के बाद हमरा जमीन बेचय के कोनो विकल्प नहि छल।ओ कहला जे हमरा 10 लाख टका क जरूरत छल।लोन नहि सम्हारलाक बाद सस्ता दाम पर जमीन बेचय पड़ल।”पंता आरू चंद के तरह नेपाल-भारत के सीमा के पास रह॑ वाला स्थानीय लोगऽ क॑ अपनऽ जमीन के उपयोग ऋण के उद्देश्य स॑ होय स॑ वंचित छै ।पंता कहलनि जे, एहि इलाका के स्थानीय लोक के उच्च ब्याज दर पर मनी ऋणदाता सं ऋण उधार लेबय लेल मजबूर अछि, किया कि वित्तीय संस्थान हमर जमीन के जमानत के लेल इस्तेमाल करय सं मना क दैत छथिन्ह.स्थानीय लोक सरकारी अधिकारी सं आग्रह करैत छथिन्ह जे हुनकर समस्या कम करय.चौधर नदी भुदा के बीचोबीच स बहैत अछि।नदी दू देशक प्राकृतिक सीमा थिक-पूर्वी पक्ष नेपाल आ पश्चिमी भाग भारत थिक ।मुदा वित्तीय संस्थान ऋण जारी करबाक सीमा क संबंध मे अपन मानक तय केलक।नेपाल-भारत सीमा के भीतर 200 मीटर स॑ एक किलोमीटर तक के जमानत के लेलऽ ई जमीन के उपयोग नै करै छै ।बेलौरी केरऽ नाबिल बैंक केरऽ प्रबंधक पंकज भट्टा न॑ कहलकै कि ई भव्यता नो-मैन-लैंड स॑ ५०० मीटर तलक के जमीन क॑ स्वीकार नै करै छै आरू जहाँ सीमा विवाद छै, वहाँ मानदंड आरू भी अधिक छै ।भट्टा कहला जे बैंक क अपन आंतरिक निर्देश आ कार्य दिशा निर्देश अछि।“ जोखिम मूल्यांकन के बाद ही जमानत स्वीकार करै छै।”देश केरऽ सबस॑ पुरानऽ वाणिज्यिक बैंक नेपाल बैंक लिमिटेड न॑ कोलेटरल लेली नो-मैन-लैंड स॑ २०० मीटर के भीतर जमीन क॑ स्वीकार नै करै छै ।ओ कहला जे विवादित सीमा क्षेत्र क मामला मे हम सीमा स एक किलोमीटर तक क जमानत लेल जमीन क उपयोग नहि क सकैत छी।संपार्श्विक के उपयोग जोखिम मूल्यांकन के आधार पर करलऽ जाय छै,’’ नेपाल बैंक लिमिटेड केरऽ महेंद्रनगर शाखा के प्रबंधक महेश राज जोशी न॑ कहलकै ।सामान्यतया, नदी या धारक कें किनारे पर जे जमीन छै, जमीन, जे सड़कक सं जुड़ल नहि छै, कानूनी जटिलता वाला जमीन, जमीन जे केवल छह महीना सं पहिने पंजीकृत छै आ सरकार कें द्वारा प्राप्त जमीनक कें उपयोग ऋण कें लेल जमानत कें रूप मे नहि कैल जा सकय छै. उद्देश्य।मुदा वाणिज्यिक बैंक जमानत के लेल जमीन के अस्वीकार करय लेल अपन दिशा निर्देश दैत अछि.नेपाल रस्त्र बैंक, नेपाल के केंद्रीय बैंक जे वित्तीय संस्थान के नियंत्रित करैत अछि, कहैत अछि जे कोलेटरल के लेल नो-मैन-लैंड के सीमा में जे जमीन के सीमा अछि ओकर संबंध में एहन कोनो नियम नै अछि।नेपाल रसरा बैंक सेंट्रल कार्यालय केरऽ सहायक सूचना अधिकारी भगवत आचार्य न॑ कहलकै कि ऐसनऽ कोय काम करै के दिशा-निर्देश नै छै जे नेपाल-भारत के संपार्श्विक लेली सटलऽ जमीनऽ के इस्तेमाल स॑ रोकै छै ।बैंक ऋण लेबा मे मात्र झंझट नहि, नेपाल-इंडिया सीमा लग रहय वाला स्थानीय लोक के कईटा आओर समस्या सहय पड़त.सीमा सुरक्ष बाल (एसएसबी) कर्मी कखनो-कखनो लोगक कें ओय जमीनक कें उपयोग करय सं रोकय छै जइ कें ओकरा पास जमीन कें स्वामित्व प्रमाणपत्र छै, नेपाली पक्ष मे हथियार कें साथ प्रवेश करनाय आ अन्य कें साथ निष्पादित विकास गतिविधियक मे बाधा पहुंचानाय.नेपाल आ भारत मे कनचनपुर जिला मे 129.5 किलोमीटर लंबा सीमा अछि।प्राधिकारी द्वारा उपलब्ध करायल गेल जानकारी के अनुसार जिला में कुल 390 मुख्य, सहायक आ छोट सीमा के स्तंभ अछि।ओहि मे 32टा स्तंभ गायब भ गेल अछि जखन कि बाढ़ि स 41 स्तंभ क्षतिग्रस्त भ गेल अछि।बहुत रास आओर सीमाक खंभाक हालत जर्जर अछि ।सीमा के स्तंभ के अभाव के कारण सीमा विवाद के कारण स्थानीय लोगऽ के दावा छै कि भारत केरऽ एसएसबी अक्सर नेपाली तरफ सड़क निर्माण सहित निर्माण गतिविधियऽ म॑ हस्तक्षेप करै छै ।सीमा के नेपाली तरफ सामुदायिक जंगल में वृक्षारोपण के कार्यक्रम में भी गड़बड़ी पैदा करै छै ।प्यारतल में पुरबास, पचुई और बेलाौरी नगरपालिका के भूडादी के झुदामा के आनन्दबाजार से सीमा विवादों है ग्रामीण नगरपालिका, कुतियकभर के बदुधर के बदुवातोल से कनचनपुर में भुमदुट्टेव के नगरपालिका क्षेत्र |
